link.part: Members of the Kennedy family at the birthday ofJoseph P. Kennedy, Sr.in September 1963.

article.paragraph: TheKennedy familyis an American family who are prominent inPolitics of the United StatesAmerican politics, government, and business. The first Kennedys to reside in America werePatrick Kennedy (18231858)Patrick Kennedyand Bridget Murphy, who sailed from Ireland to America in 1849. Their sonP. J. KennedyP. J.went into politics and business. P. J. and his wife, Mary Hickey, were the parents of businessman and politicianJoseph P. Kennedy, Sr.The four sons of Joseph Sr. andRose KennedyRose FitzgeraldwereJoseph P. Kennedy, Jr.Joseph Jr.,John F. KennedyJohn,Robert F. KennedyRobert, andTed KennedyTed. John served asPresident of the United Statespresident, while Robert and Ted both became prominentUnited States Senatesenators. The Kennedys' political involvement has revolved around theDemocratic Party (United States)Democratic Party.Harvard Universityeducations have been common among them, and they have contributed heavily to that university'sJohn F. Kennedy School of Government. The wealth and glamour of the family members, as well as their extensive and continuing involvement in public service, has elevated them toCultural iconiconicstatus over the past half-century, with the Kennedys sometimes referred to as "America's Royal Family".

Joseph Sr. originally pinned his hopes on eldest son, Joseph Jr., to enter politics and be elected president. After Joseph Jr. was killed duringWorld War II, however, those hopes later fell on his second son, John, to become president. Soon after JohnUnited States presidential election, 1960was elected in 1960, he, Robert, and Ted all held prominent positions in the federal government. They received intense publicity, often emphasizing their relative youth, allure, education, and future in politics. Between 1947 and 2011, there were 64 years with a Kennedy in elective office inWashington, D.C.Washington. This spans more than a quarter of the nation's existence.cite newshttp://www.boston.com/news/local/rhode_island/articles/2010/02/13/pondering_a_congress_without_kennedys/Pondering a Congress without KennedysMichaelLevenson[[The Boston Globe]]February 13, 2010

The family has been at the center of many deaths, contributing to the idea of the "Kennedy curse".Rosemary KennedyRosemarywas forced to undergo a lobotomy which crippled her entire life;Assassination of John F. KennedyJohnandAssassination of Robert F. KennedyRobertwere both assassinated during the 1960s; Ted was involved in theChappaquiddick incidentin 1969, which caused the death of his young colleague,Mary Jo Kopechne; and Joseph Jr.,Kathleen Cavendish, Marchioness of HartingtonKathleen, andJohn F. Kennedy Jr.John Jr.all died in plane crashes.
article.heading: Family tree
Coat of Arms

template.arg: The Grant of Arms granting this Arms to all descendants of Patrick Kennedy was presented to John Fitzgerald Kennedy Sr. from the Chief Herald of Ireland on 17 March 1961, St. Patrick's Day.
Sable three helmets in profile Or within a bordure per saltaire Gules and Ermine
Between two olive branches a cubit sinister arm in armour erect, the hand holding a sheaf of four arrows, points upwards, all proper

The 3 helmets on black alludes to the Arms of the O'Kennedys of Ormonde, and the red and Ermine allude the Arms of the FitzGeralds of Desmond. The olive branches and arrows symbolise America, because the olive branches and the arrows that appear in the Arms also appear in the talons of the American Eagle in the Great Seal of the United States of America.
